results.title: The Love bug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Herbie is one of Disney’s most popular live action characters. Affectionately nicknamed ‘The Love Bug’, Herbie teams up with an unsuccessful race-car driver, Jim Douglas. Jim is amazed to find his driving improves in his new car, but realises the success is due to the car with a mind of its own when someone tries to steal Herbie. Starring Dean Jones, David Tomlinson, Michele Lee and Buddy Hackett.

results.title: The Louvre (PC)
results.brief_description: Take an armchair trip through le Grand Louvre in Paris and discover why it is one of the world’s great museums. There is the option of taking guided tours of the masterpieces and being provided with narration, a history of the building and playing the cour caree game where you can reassemble paintings to your own specifications. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: 486 DX or higher (Pentium recommended), Windows 3.1 or higher, 8 MB of RAM, 4Mb hard drive space, 2x speed CD-ROM drive (4x recommended), 640x480 screen, 256 colors (32,000 recommended).

results.title: The Louis Armstrong All-Stars
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Recorded in New York City in 1962 as part of a jazz promotion sponsored by Good Year, this film features a great band playing popular jazz standards. Joining Armstrong on trumpet are Trummy Young on trombone, Billy Kyle on piano and the fabulous Jewel Brown on vocals. Armstrong plays “C’est Si Bon”, “Someday”, “Nobody Knows the Trouble I’ve Seen” and a rousing finale of “When the Saints Go Marching In”.

results.title: The Lottery
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Shirley Jackson’s chilling story about a small American town and its annual lottery ritual. Explores the concepts of violence and tradition, highlighting their senselessness in our time. Suiable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Lost world of the Maya
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and David Collison
results.brief_description: For over a thousand years the Maya civilisation grew and flourished in the rain forests of Central America until it was discovered and destroyed by the Spanish conquistadores. Eric Thompson, well-known authority on the Maya, describes the struggle to comprehend the vanished civilisation, and the fight to preserve its treasures for posterity. Sites featured are Tikal, Palenque, Yaxchilan, Copan, Quirigua, Chichen Itza, Uxmal and Tulum.

results.title: The Lost World Jurassic Park for Game Boy
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, cartridge case, consumer information booklet, Nintendo Power subscription form, registration card, poster and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Based on the movie of the same name, The Lost World: Jurassic Park is set on Isla Sorna, also known as “Site B”, where dinosaurs were created to populate the original park. As an agent for InGen, the player must recover eggs, DNA and key information on the cloning process before BioSyn, a rival company, gets their hands on it. Gameplay consists of running, jumping and climbing through the buildings, jungles and caves of the island. Getting in the player’s way are BioSyn thugs and a variety of dinosaurs, such as Pterodactyl, Triceratops and the eponymous Tyrannosaurus Rex. The player can defend himself by using kicks, punches and weapons, as well as ammo and health power-ups.

results.title: The Lost weekend
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Charles Brackett and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: This classic Hollywood drama scooped the Oscars in 1945 and it is not surprising. Ray Milland is an alcoholic writer who cannot control his binge drinking. Over a torturous weekend we see how the lure of alcohol has destroyed his confidence, his self-respect and his ambition. As it threatens to eat away at his talent, he comes closer and closer to suicidal despair. From a contemporary perspective the moralistic ending may appear trite but what is undeniable is Billy Wilder’s talent at creating a film which seems to visually simulate the terrifying perspective of a drug user’s imagination. Milland too is excellent as a man who is unable to reach the goals he sets himself. As a study of writer’s block, “The Lost Weekend” is both perceptive and illuminating. Jane Wyman appears as his long-suffering lover, however the book’s original narrative linked the writer’s fear of failure to his ambiguous sexuality. An outstanding film. Based on the book by Charles Jackson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Pictures, Charles Brackett and Billy Wilder

results.title: The Lost wax method of bronze casting
results.creator_credit: Fotosonic, Harmon Foundation and Leo Steiner
results.brief_description: Vincent Kofi, a Ghanian sculptor, is shown making a bronze casting of his “Awakening Africa” using the lost wax method. The process - from modelling the original clay figurine to the finished work on the metal casting - is shown.

results.title: The Lost waters of the Nile
results.creator_credit: Alec Nisbett, KRO-TV Hilversum and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Report on the issues surrounding the construction of the Jonglei Canal, a massive engineering project intended to bypass an enormous area of marshland formed by the waters of the White Nile. Considers in particular the effects on the Dinka people who inhabit the area and the difficulties facing the builders of the canal.

results.title: The Lost tribe
results.creator_credit: Meridian Films, New Zealand Film Commission, Gary Hannam and John Laing
results.brief_description: In this suspense thriller, a missing anthropologist is given up for lost by his wife (Darien Takle) and twin brother Edward (John Bach), but his daughter (Emma Takle) is convinced something odd is involved in her father’s disappearance. Events conspire to put the three people together on a manhunt for the anthropologist amongst a “lost” tribe in the dense jungle of the southern island of New Zealand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Meridian Films, New Zealand Film Commission, Gary Hannam and John Laing
results.description: In this suspense thriller, a missing anthropologist is given up for lost by his wife (Darien Takle) and twin brother Edward (John Bach), but his daughter (Emma Takle) is convinced something odd is involved in her father’s disappearance.
